Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Tourniquet Use in Total Knee Arthroplasty

Trial_Design.evidence: randomised to either continuous tourniquet use from incision through cementation (operative tourniquet group) or tourniquet use only during cementation (cementation tourniquet group)

Participants.evidence: 71 patients (79 knees) undergoing TKA, randomised to either continuous tourniquet use from incision through cementation (operative tourniquet group) or tourniquet use only during cementation (cementation tourniquet group). Conducted at a single institution, the study excluded patients at high risk for tourniquet-related complications.

Intervention.evidence: randomised to either continuous tourniquet use from incision through cementation (operative tourniquet group) or tourniquet use only during cementation (cementation tourniquet group)

Objective.evidence: This study investigates the impact of limited tourniquet use during cementation only.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was surgical time, with secondary outcomes including postoperative pain, knee motion, blood loss, and complications.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was achieved via a computer-generated sequence with allocation concealment.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Analysis showed no significant differences between groups in surgical time, pain scores, pain medication requirements, range of motion, hemoglobin change, or total blood loss.

Harms.evidence: One major complication, compartment syndrome, was reported in the operative tourniquet group.

Trial_Registration.evidence: Trial registration and funding information were not disclosed.

Funding.evidence: Trial registration and funding information were not disclosed.
